description: System-generated unique identifier for this downtime cost transaction.
Coded classification of the cost entry (e.g., charge, credit, adjustment); mapping defined by system reference values; confirm with SME.
Total hours the asset was unavailable during this event, used to calculate downtime costs.
Code indicating the nature of downtime (e.g., planned, unplanned, safety); mapping required; confirm with SME.
Hourly rate representing lost production value when the asset is down; used to compute downtime impact.
Hourly maintenance cost rate applied during downtime (e.g., labor/overhead) for cost calculations.
Identifier of the user associated with this transaction (creator or owner); confirm role with SME.
Reference to the person or external party to contact regarding this downtime or cost entry; likely a contact record ID.
Identifier of the affected vehicle or equipment unit for which downtime costs are recorded.
Link to a maintenance procedure or standard job applied to this event; likely references a procedure catalog; confirm with SME.
Project or job code to which this downtime cost is allocated.

Indicates allocation of costs across multiple GL accounts, or references split details; confirm implementation with SME.
Associated work order that triggered or recorded this downtime and related costs.
Related purchase order for parts or services tied to this cost.
Timestamp when the downtime cost transaction was logged into the system.
Date and time the cost entry was adjusted or reallocated, if applicable.
System timestamp of the most recent update to this record.
Free-text notes providing context or explanations about the downtime or cost.
Identifier of the user who last modified this record; data type or content may vary; confirm with SME.
